file_content.text: Interesting group you've got here. It takes all kinds, I guess.
Against this enemy, anyone we can find.
We share a common enemy and desire, that's enough.
Seen stranger crowds come together for worse reasons.
Desperation makes for strange bed fellows.
Not the strangest for some of us.
One. More. Word.
Enough.
Cool it.
Fun as this is, I need to get back to Havoc.
I've requisitioned passable training gear to issue the rebels, at least until they can keep from shooting their own toes off.
I can't believe we're going to ask civilians to fight our battles. It doesn't feel right.
They're going to do this whether we help or not. Teaching them how to is what's best for them, and us.
A more rigorous analysis would suggest the cost benefit is more strictly in their favor.
That depends on what you're measuring, SCORPIO.
For your priorities maybe.
The projected impact of Havoc Squad's direct intervention versus a model of successful guerilla insurrections over the same duration.
I'm willing to make some sacrifices to help these people.
It's worth it to me.
That is your foolish prerogative. I will attempt to compensate for it.
If we succeed at fostering a rebellion on Zakuul, it may hamper Arcann long enough for the rest of the galaxy to strike back.
It's an investment.
It is not my understanding of the situation that needs to be corrected.
Pushy droid you've got.
You don't want to call her that.
What? "Pushy"?
"Droid". The extent of my being is beyond your comprehension.
Yeah. Clearly.
If you need me, you know where to look.
I'll ensure the rebels get their supply drop before we withdraw.
You're going to arm civilians and set them loose without any supervision? Have you lost it?
I know I must have, because I'm on her side for once!
Explain how "here's some guns, good luck" is anything like a good idea!
The exiles want to stand for themselves. Have one conversation with Pashna and you'll understand.
It's how they want it.
Don't think I won't. There's proud and then there's stupid.
And then there's both.
They can at least fend for themselves this way. We can't support a refugee population long term.
Better than nothing.
But--
Remember what their lives would be like without us, Koth.
This measure isn't a solution, but it is an improvement.
Because none of us has the time to help them play toy soldier.
Cost versus benefit.
If they want to help, I'll take it, but they could never be a reliable force for our needs.
We'll just have to hope that their revolution won't end up distracting from our own efforts.
When you've figured out what those are, let me know. Otherwise, I'll be in the field hunting for targets of opportunity.
